item.title: Jacki add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "God put me on earth to accomplish certain things. Right now, I’m so far behind, I’ll never die." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "A work of art works because it is true, not because it is real." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Don’t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Everybody is a genius. But if you judge a fish by its ability to climb a tree, it will live its whole life believing that it is stupid." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "You know what's weird? Day by day, nothing seems to change, but pretty soon...everything's different." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Who was the guy who first looked at a cow and said 'I think I’ll drink whatever comes out of these when I squeeze ’em?" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "There's never enough time to do all the nothing you want." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "In my opinion, we don't devote nearly enough scientific research to finding a cure for jerks." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Bill Watterson
Jacki add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I hate to think that all my current experiences will someday become stories with no point." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "Just as music is noise that makes sense, a painting is color that makes sense, so a story is life that makes sense." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Fyodor Dostoyevsky
item.description: "...For active love is a harsh and fearful thing compared with love in dreams. Love in dreams thirsts for immediate action, quickly performed, and with everyone watching. Indeed, it will go as far as the giving even of one's life, provided it does not take long but is soon over, as on stage, and everyone is looking on and praising. Whereas active love is labor and perseverance, and for some people, perhaps, a whole science." -- Fyodor Dostoyevsky

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "The Bible is very easy to understand. But we Christians are a bunch of scheming swindlers. We pretend to be unable to understand it because we know very well that the minute we understand, we are obliged to act accordingly." -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Soren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Love is the expression of the one who loves, not of the one who is loved. Those who think they can love only the people they prefer do not love at all. Love discovers truths about individuals that others cannot see" -- Soren Kierkegaard

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Søren Kierkegaard
item.description: "Men think that it is impossible for a human being to love his enemies, for enemies are hardly able to endure the sight of one another. Well, then, shut your eyes--and your enemy looks just like your neighbor." -- Søren Kierkegaard

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jacki add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Wrinkles should merely indicate where the smiles have been." -- Mark Twain
